summary.name: obesity.json
summary.dataset_description: A dataset containing obesity rates by state and region in the United States.

properties.description: A unique identifier for each state.
The obesity rate for each state.
The state in the United States.
The region in the United States.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity rates across all states?
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of obesity rates across all states and identify any outliers.

goals.question: What is the average obesity rate by region?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of average obesity rate by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us compare the obesity rates across different regions and identify any patterns or trends.

goals.question: Which state has the highest obesity rate?
goals.visualization: Bar chart of obesity rates by state
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify the state with the highest obesity rate and compare it to other states.

goals.question: Is there a correlation between obesity rates and region?
goals.visualization: Scatter plot of obesity rates by region
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us identify any correlation between obesity rates and region and understand if certain regions have higher obesity rates than others.

goals.question: What is the distribution of obesity rates by state?
goals.visualization: Box plot of obesity rates by state
goals.rationale: This visualization will help us understand the spread of obesity rates across different states and identify any outliers.

code:
import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.histplot(data=data, x='rate', kde=True, color='blue')
    plt.title('What is the distribution of obesity rates across all states?', wrap=True)
    plt.axvline(data['rate'].mean(), color='red', linestyle='dashed', linewidth=1, label='Mean: {:.2f}'.format(data['rate'].mean()))
    plt.legend()
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.groupby('region')['rate'].mean().reset_index()
    chart = sns.barplot(x='region', y='rate', data=data)
    plt.title('What is the average obesity rate by region?', wrap=True)
    for index, row in data.iterrows():
        chart.text(row.name, row.rate, round(row.rate, 2), color='black', ha="center")
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    data = data.sort_values(by='rate', ascending=False)
    chart = sns.barplot(x='state', y='rate', data=data, color='blue')
    chart.axhline(y=data['rate'].max(), color='red', linestyle='--', label=f'Max Rate: {data["rate"].max():.2f}')
    chart.set_xticklabels(chart.get_xticklabels(), rotation=90)
    chart.legend()
    return chart

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.scatterplot(x='region', y='rate', data=data)
    plt.title('Is there a correlation between obesity rates and region?', wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)

import seaborn as sns
import pandas as pd
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

def plot(data: pd.DataFrame):
    sns.set(style="whitegrid")
    chart = sns.boxplot(x="state", y="rate", data=data)
    plt.title("What is the distribution of obesity rates by state?", wrap=True)
    return plt;

chart = plot(data)
